alert.note: Alert for Eastern Douglas County Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 29 at 2:01PM PST until December 02 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THURSDAY TO 4 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 3500 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 3500 feet, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch above 4000 feet, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 20 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Eastern Douglas County Foothills. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM Thursday to 4 AM PST Friday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from 4 AM PST Friday through Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.comfor latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
